page.content: In the village of Linstock there is market garden owned by the Lamb family.The building was built in 1797. It has been a market garden for 70 years.Before MR Lamb owned it his father and grandfather owned it 50 years ago.He has 6 acres of land,0.33 of greenhouses.He grows lettuces, tomatoes,potatoes,cucumbers,beans, courgettes,cellery,green peppers, beetroots,leeks,brussel sprouts, cabbage,and spring onions.MR Lamb sells his vegtables to the market in CARLISLE.MRS Lamb said the soil is good but we cannot grow carrots.They plant the lettuces every 2 weeks, the vegtables are not ready together because they plant them at different times. BY Caroline Todd Rachel Clapperton.
